definition: to give or have an injection
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: The pirate Modi did not like shots.
I think it is no use .
Injections of tens of thousands take medicine, go out empty-handed back empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 打針吃藥好幾萬，空手出門空手返。

sentences.english: Electroporation takes 3–4 seconds and the sensation is similar to a punch in the arm.
sentences.chinese: 電穿孔需要3到4秒，而且感覺與在手臂上打針類似。

sentences.english: Are you feeling a pain when I use the drill? Then I will use an injection for anesthesia?
sentences.chinese: 當我鑽牙時有感覺痛嗎？如果有，我將給您打針麻藥。

sentences.english: She can needle herself if need be.
sentences.chinese: 必要時她會給她自己打針的。

sentences.english: Also, players using Marines in the original StarCraft still used Stim Pack often.
sentences.chinese: 而且，大家過去玩星際的時候也經常給槍兵打針。

sentences.english: It took three nurses to hold him down while they gave him the injection .
sentences.chinese: 他們給他打針時用了三個護士把他按住。

sentences.english: I hconsumed injections, Can I take the medicine orally?
sentences.chinese: 常用降壓藥我不喜歡打針，能喫些口服藥嗎？

sentences.english: Ferrets should be immunized for Rabies and Canine Distemper using only vaccines approved for use in ferrets.
sentences.chinese: 每年打針可以使用與雪貂的狂犬疫苗和犬瘟熱疫苗。

sentences.english: She pressed the patient a bit too hard when she gave him an injection.
“As for the needles, ” I say, “they’re like anything else.
sentences.chinese: “至於打針，”我說，“打針就像別的事情一樣。

sentences.english: “As for the needles, ” I say, “they’re like anything else.
sentences.chinese: “至於打針，”我說，“打針就像別的事情一樣。

sentences.english: After the injection her pain began to ease off.
sentences.chinese: 打針後她的疼痛開始減輕了。

sentences.english: Refusing injections is the worst thing you can do to your health.
sentences.chinese: 對於個人健康來說，拒絕打針是最糟糕的事情了。

sentences.english: Yes, it's quite serious. I think you need a shot.
sentences.chinese: 好的，情況相當嚴重，我想你應該打針。

definition: (of a surgeon) to perform an operation/(of a patient) to have an operation/to decapitate/to behead/to single out as a point of attack
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
to have a high temperature (from illness)/to have a fever
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
